intro: Canthium purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-veined or red-rooted spurge, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed margins and produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often containing milky sap that is toxic to livestock. Canthium purpurascens is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage.
